Package renderer

Class BasicRayTracer

java.lang.Object
renderer.RayTraceBase
renderer.BasicRayTracer
public class BasicRayTracer
extends RayTraceBase
finds intersections between the ray and the scene, and calculates the color of the closest intersection

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private static double INITIAL_K
    initialize the effect on the pixel's color (Coefficient of attenuation), at first its value is 1
    private static int MAX_CALC_COLOR_LEVEL
    Stop condition in the recursion of transparencies / reflections (If the number of recursive calls we made is higher than the above constant then we will no longer make any more readings)
    private static double MIN_CALC_COLOR_K
    Stop condition in the recursion of transparencies / reflections (If the effect on the pixel's color is lower than the above constant (Coefficient of attenuation) then it is really marginal and we will not consider it)

    Fields inherited from class renderer.RayTraceBase

    scene

    Calculates the effect of the degree of scattering of the material from which the shape is made on the color that this point will receive
    private Color calcGlobalEffects​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray ray, int level, double k)
    Function for calculating the global effects of the type of material from which the shape is made on the color that the dot acquires in the scene, depending on the degree of reflection of the material and degree of refraction (To what extent does the material cause light to refract)
    private Color calcLocalEffects​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray ray, double k)
    Function for calculating the local effects of the type of material from which the shape is made on the color that the dot acquires in the scene (depending on the degree of scattering of the material, degree of glossy and its degree of transparency (The level at which it is transparent, through which can be seen))

    Calculates the effect of the degree of glossy of the material from which the shape is made on the color that this point will receive

    finds the closest intersection of this ray with some shape
    Color traceRay​(Ray ray)
    A method to find the closest geoIntersection between the ray and the 3D model of the scene (containing the shape and the point in 3D) in which we calculate the color by an helper functions
    private double transparency​(LightSource ls, Vector l, Vector n, Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint)
    A function which calculates the effect of material transparency on how much can be seen through it

  • Field Details

    • MIN_CALC_COLOR_K

      private static final double MIN_CALC_COLOR_K
      Stop condition in the recursion of transparencies / reflections (If the effect on the pixel's color is lower than the above constant (Coefficient of attenuation) then it is really marginal and we will not consider it)
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • MAX_CALC_COLOR_LEVEL

      private static final int MAX_CALC_COLOR_LEVEL
      Stop condition in the recursion of transparencies / reflections (If the number of recursive calls we made is higher than the above constant then we will no longer make any more readings)
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

      private static final double INITIAL_K
      initialize the effect on the pixel's color (Coefficient of attenuation), at first its value is 1

  • Constructor Details

    • BasicRayTracer

      public BasicRayTracer​(Scene scene)
      CTOR
      Parameters:
      scene - The scene where we look for the intersections

  • Method Details

    • traceRay

      public Color traceRay​(Ray ray)
      A method to find the closest geoIntersection between the ray and the 3D model of the scene (containing the shape and the point in 3D) in which we calculate the color by an helper functions
      Specified by:
      traceRay in class RayTraceBase
      Parameters:
      ray - 3D ray
      Returns:
      the backGround's color at default (no intersections found) else: the color at this point using method - calcColor(GeoPoint, Ray) : Color

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint closestPoint, Ray ray)
      calculates the Color at the given point using pong's model
      Parameters:
      closestPoint - the point where we are interested in knowing what her color is in the scene, and in addition we send to the function the type of shape that is at this point, because we also need to know the type of material from which the shape is made in order to know what final color this point gets
      ray - The ray that comes out of the camera and intersects the scene at this point, we will use it to calculate local effects and global effects on the color in the appropriate function we call it
      Returns:
      The color at the given point

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint intersection, Ray ray, int level, double k)
      calculates the color at the given point considering all the local and general effects that have on that point using the appropriate functions
      Parameters:
      intersection - the point where we are interested in knowing what her color is in the scene, and in addition we send to the function the type of shape that is at this point, because we also need to know the type of material from which the shape is made in order to know what final color this point gets
      ray - The ray that comes out of the camera and intersects the scene at this point, we will use it to calculate local effects & global effects on the color
      level - Stop condition in the recursion of transparencies / reflections (If the number of recursive calls we made is higher than the above constant then we will no longer make any more readings)
      k - Stop condition in the recursion of transparencies / reflections (If the effect on the pixel's color is lower than k (Coefficient of attenuation) then it is really marginal and we will not consider it)
      Returns:
      The color at the given point considering all the local and general effects

    • calcDiffusive

      private Color calcDiffusive​(double kd, Vector l, Vector n, Color lightIntensity)
      Calculates the effect of the degree of scattering of the material from which the shape is made on the color that this point will receive
      Parameters:
      kd - Coefficient of attenuation of the degree of diffusion
      l - Vector coming out of the light to the point (which we calculate its color)
      n - A normal vector that coming out of the point on the geometric shape that we calculate its color
      lightIntensity - The intensity of the light source
      Returns:
      The color that the point receive according to the calculation of the diffusion (Kd * |l * n| * Il) (pong's model)

    • calcSpecular

      private Color calcSpecular​(double ks, Vector l, Vector n, Vector v, int nShininess, Color lightIntensity)
      Calculates the effect of the degree of glossy of the material from which the shape is made on the color that this point will receive
      Parameters:
      ks - Coefficient of attenuation of the degree of glossy
      l - Vector coming out of the light to the point (which we calculate its color)
      n - A normal vector that coming out of the point on the geometric shape that we calculate its color
      v - Vector coming out of the camera to the point
      nShininess - How gloss the shape is
      lightIntensity - The intensity of the light source
      Returns:
      The color that the point receive according to the calculation of the glossy ks * (max[0, -v * r]) ^ nSh * Il

    • calcLocalEffects

      private Color calcLocalEffects​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray ray, double k)
      Function for calculating the local effects of the type of material from which the shape is made on the color that the dot acquires in the scene (depending on the degree of scattering of the material, degree of glossy and its degree of transparency (The level at which it is transparent, through which can be seen))
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the point where we are interested in knowing what her color is in the scene, and in addition we send to the function the type of shape that is at this point, because we need information about the material from which the shape is made in order to know what final color this point gets
      ray - The ray that intersects geoPoint (comes from the camera or from some shape that is in the scene that has an element of reflection or transparency)
      Returns:
      The color at the given point = sigma on i [all light-sources] ([kd * |li * n| + ks * (max[0, -v * r]) ^ nSh] * Ili * Si)

    • calcGlobalEffects

      private Color calcGlobalEffects​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray ray, int level, double k)
      Function for calculating the global effects of the type of material from which the shape is made on the color that the dot acquires in the scene, depending on the degree of reflection of the material and degree of refraction (To what extent does the material cause light to refract)
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the point where we are interested in knowing what her color is in the scene, and in addition we send to the function the type of shape that is at this point, because we need information about the material from which the shape is made in order to know what final color this point gets
      ray - The ray that intersects geoPoint (comes from the camera or from some shape that is in the scene that has an element of reflection or transparency)
      level - Stop condition in the recursion of transparencies / reflections (If the number of recursive calls we made is higher than the above constant then we will no longer make any more readings)
      k - Stop condition in the recursion of transparencies / reflections (If the effect on the pixel's color is lower than k (Coefficient of attenuation) then it is really marginal and we will not consider it)
      Returns:
      The color at the given point = sigma on i [all light-sources] ([kd * |li * n| + ks * (max[0, -v * r]) ^ nSh] * Ili * Si) + kr * IR + kt * It)

    • constructRefractedRay

      private Ray constructRefractedRay​(Vector n, Point3D point, Ray ray)
      Builds a ray that comes out of the shape with the material that refracts the light
      Parameters:
      n - the normal vector at this point (using for offset the ray's head by DELTA in this direction)
      point - The point from which the ray emerges
      ray - the original ray
      Returns:
      new ray after offset the ray's head by DELTA in the normal vector's direction

    • constructReflectedRay

      private Ray constructReflectedRay​(Vector n, Point3D point, Ray ray)
      Builds a ray that comes out of the shape with the material that has reflection
      Parameters:
      n - the normal vector from the shape's surface at this point (using for offset the ray's head by DELTA in this direction)
      point - The point from which the ray emerges
      ray - the original ray
      Returns:
      new ray after offset the ray's head by DELTA in the normal vector's direction

    • findClosestIntersection

      private Intersectable.GeoPoint findClosestIntersection​(Ray ray)
      finds the closest intersection of this ray with some shape
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray we want to find its closest intersection
      Returns:
      GeoPoint (includes the point of intersection and the shape we have at this point)

    • transparency

      private double transparency​(LightSource ls, Vector l, Vector n, Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint)
      A function which calculates the effect of material transparency on how much can be seen through it
      Parameters:
      ls - The light source for which we want to calculate the transparency
      l - the direction vector from the light source to the geoPoint
      n - the normal vector from the shape's surface at this point (using for offset the ray's head by DELTA in this direction)
      geoPoint - the point we want to calculate its transparency
      Returns:
      Transparency's intensity (measured in doubles)
